title: More efficient handling of disk sorting required when there are border values for row values
description: When sorting data on disk, if there are 40000 rows of data and the program is set to process data less than 40000, the current logic performs the following operation:
OB: 1. [Please provide the details of the operation here]
EB: The logic for disk sorting should be improved to handle border values for row values more effectively.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Set up a program to sort data on disk.
2. Use 40000 rows of data.
3. Specify to process data less than 40000.
